questions.stem: The compound which will have the lowest rate towards nucleophilic aromatic substitution on treatment with \(\mathrm{OH}^{-}\) is
questions.explanation: Electron withdrawing groups are highly ineffective at meta position in nucleophilic aromatic substitution reactions. The compound with EWG at meta position will have the lowest rate.
questions.tip_formula: EWG at meta position = ineffective for nucleophilic aromatic substitution
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The variation of the rate of an enzyme catalyzed reaction with substrate concentration is correctly represented by graph
questions.explanation: For enzyme catalyzed reactions, the rate initially increases with substrate concentration and then reaches a maximum (Vmax) due to saturation of enzyme active sites, following Michaelis-Menten kinetics.
questions.tip_formula: Michaelis-Menten kinetics: v = Vmax[S]/(Km + [S])
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Identify the product formed (A and E)
questions.explanation: The reaction involves oxidation of toluene to benzoic acid followed by esterification and other transformations as shown in the reaction scheme.
questions.tip_formula: Toluene → Benzoic acid via oxidation; Carboxylic acid → Ester via esterification
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Match List I with List II
questions.explanation: K gives violet flame, Ca gives brick red, Sr gives crimson red, Ba gives apple green in flame test.
questions.tip_formula: Flame test colors: K-Violet, Ca-Brick red, Sr-Crimson red, Ba-Apple green
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Reaction of thionyl chloride with white phosphorus forms a compound [A], which on hydrolysis gives [B], a dibasic acid. [A] and [B] are respectively
questions.explanation: P₄ + 8SOCl₂ → 4PCl₃ [A] + 4SO₂ + 2S₂Cl₂; PCl₃ + 3H₂O → H₃PO₃ [B] + 3HCl
questions.tip_formula: P₄ + SOCl₂ → PCl₃; PCl₃ + H₂O → H₃PO₃
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: A cubic solid is made up of two elements X and Y. Atoms of X are present on every alternate corner and one at the center of cube. Y is at 1/3 of the total faces. The empirical formula of the compound is
questions.explanation: X atoms: 4 corners × 1/8 + 1 center × 1 = 1.5; Y atoms: 6 faces × 1/3 × 1/2 = 1; Empirical formula = X₁.₅Y₁ = X₃Y₂
questions.tip_formula: Corner contribution = 1/8, Face center = 1/2, Body center = 1
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The radius of the 2nd orbit of Li²⁺ is x. The expected radius of the 3rd orbit of Be³⁺ is
questions.explanation: r ∝ n²/Z; For Li²⁺: r₂ = k × 2²/3 = 4k/3 = x; For Be³⁺: r₃ = k × 3²/4 = 9k/4; r₃/x = (9k/4)/(4k/3) = 27/16
questions.tip_formula: Bohr radius formula: r ∝ n²/Z
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Which of the following conformations will be the most stable?
questions.explanation: The staggered conformation has the lowest van der Waals and torsional strain, making it the most stable conformation.
questions.tip_formula: Staggered conformation = most stable (minimum steric and torsional strain)
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Match items of Row I with those of Row II
questions.explanation: P represents α-D-(+) Glucopyranose, Q represents β-D-(+) Glucopyranose, R represents α-D-(-) Fructofuranose, S represents β-D-(-) Fructofuranose
questions.tip_formula: α-anomer: OH down at anomeric carbon; β-anomer: OH up at anomeric carbon
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Assertion A: Acetal/Ketal is stable in basic medium. Reason R: The high leaving tendency of alkoxide ion gives the stability to acetal/ketal in basic medium.

options.text: A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true
Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A

questions.explanation: Acetals and ketals are stable in basic medium but break down in acidic medium. However, alkoxide ion (RO⁻) is NOT a good leaving group, so the reason is false.
questions.tip_formula: Acetals stable in base, unstable in acid; RO⁻ is poor leaving group
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Inert gases have positive electron gain enthalpy. Its correct order is
questions.explanation: Electron gain enthalpy values: He = +48 kJ/mol, Ne = +116 kJ/mol, Kr = +96 kJ/mol, Xe = +77 kJ/mol. Order: Ne > Kr > Xe > He
questions.tip_formula: Noble gas electron gain enthalpy: Ne > Kr > Xe > He (all positive)
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Which one of the following reactions does not occur during extraction of copper?
questions.explanation: In copper extraction, FeO forms FeSiO₃ (slag) with SiO₂, but CaSiO₃ is not formed as calcium oxide is not involved in copper extraction process.
questions.tip_formula: Copper extraction: CuFeS₂ + O₂ → Cu₂S + FeO + SO₂; FeO + SiO₂ → FeSiO₃ (slag)
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The correct sequence of reagents for the preparation of Q and R is:

options.text: (i) Cr₂O₃, 770 K, 20 atm; (ii) CrO₂Cl₂, H₃O⁺; (iii) NaOH; (iv) H₃O⁺
(i) CrO₂Cl₂, H₃O⁺; (ii) Cr₂O₃, 770 K, 20 atm; (iii) NaOH; (iv) H₃O⁺
(i) KMnO₄, OH⁻; (ii) Mo₂O₃, Δ; (iii) NaOH; (iv) H₃O⁺
(i) Mo₂O₃, Δ; (ii) CrO₂Cl₂, H₃O⁺; (iii) NaOH; (iv) H₃O⁺

questions.explanation: The sequence involves catalytic dehydrogenation with Cr₂O₃ followed by oxidation with chromyl chloride and then base hydrolysis.
questions.tip_formula: Catalytic dehydrogenation: Cr₂O₃, 770K, 20 atm; Oxidation: CrO₂Cl₂
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The correct order in aqueous medium of basic strength in case of methyl substituted amines is:
questions.explanation: In aqueous medium, basic strength depends on both electron density on nitrogen and solvation of cation. Order: Me₂NH > MeNH₂ > Me₃N > NH₃ due to combined effect of +I effect and steric hindrance to solvation.
questions.tip_formula: Aqueous basicity: 2° > 1° > 3° > NH₃ (due to solvation effects)
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: '25 volume' hydrogen peroxide means

options.text: 1 L marketed solution contains 250 g of H₂O₂
1 L marketed solution contains 75 g of H₂O₂
100 mL marketed solution contains 25 g of H₂O₂
1 L marketed solution contains 25 g of H₂O₂

questions.tip_formula: Volume strength = 11.35 × Molarity; Mass = Molarity × Molecular weight
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Which of the following statements is incorrect for antibiotics?

options.text: An antibiotic must be a product of metabolism
An antibiotic is a synthetic substance produced as a structural analogue of naturally occurring antibiotic
An antibiotic should promote the growth or survival of microorganisms
An antibiotic should be effective in low concentrations

questions.explanation: Antibiotics should inhibit the growth or kill microorganisms, not promote their growth or survival.
questions.tip_formula: Antibiotics = antimicrobial agents that inhibit/kill microorganisms
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Compound A reacts with NH₄Cl and forms a compound B. Compound B reacts with H₂O and excess of CO₂ to form compound C which on passing through or reaction with saturated NaCl solution forms sodium hydrogen carbonate. Compound A, B and C, are respectively
questions.explanation: Ca(OH)₂ + 2NH₄Cl → 2NH₃ + CaCl₂ + 2H₂O; NH₃ + H₂O + CO₂ → NH₄HCO₃; NH₄HCO₃ + NaCl → NaHCO₃ + NH₄Cl
questions.tip_formula: Solvay process reactions: Ca(OH)₂ → NH₃ → NH₄HCO₃ → NaHCO₃
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Some reactions of NO₂ relevant to photochemical smog formation are given. Identify A, B, X and Y

options.text: X = [O], Y = NO, A = O₂, B = O₃
X = N₂O, Y = [O], A = O₃, B = NO
X = 1/2O₂, Y = NO₂, A = O₃, B = O₂
X = NO, Y = [O], A = O₂, B = N₂O₃

questions.explanation: In photochemical smog: NO₂ → NO + [O]; [O] + O₂ → O₃; O₃ + NO → NO₂ + O₂
questions.tip_formula: Photochemical smog cycle: NO₂ → NO + O; O + O₂ → O₃; O₃ + NO → NO₂ + O₂
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Match the List-I with List-II
questions.explanation: Group II: H₂S in dil HCl (Pb²⁺, Cu²⁺); Group III: NH₄OH in NH₄Cl (Al³⁺, Fe³⁺); Group IV: H₂S in NH₄OH (Co²⁺, Ni²⁺); Group V: (NH₄)₂CO₃ in NH₄OH (Ba²⁺, Ca²⁺)
questions.tip_formula: Qualitative analysis groups: II-H₂S/dil HCl, III-NH₄OH/NH₄Cl, IV-H₂S/NH₄OH, V-(NH₄)₂CO₃/NH₄OH
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: In the cumene to phenol preparation in presence of air, the intermediate is
questions.explanation: In cumene process, cumene hydroperoxide is formed as intermediate which rearranges to phenol and acetone.
questions.tip_formula: Cumene process: C₆H₅CH(CH₃)₂ + O₂ → C₆H₅C(OOH)(CH₃)₂ → C₆H₅OH + CH₃COCH₃
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: An athlete is given 100 g of glucose (C₆H₁₂O₆) for energy. This is equivalent to 1800 kJ of energy. The 50% of this energy gained is utilized by the athlete for sports activities at the event. In order to avoid storage of energy, the weight of extra water he would need to perspire is ______ g (Nearest integer). Given: The enthalpy of evaporation of water is 45 kJ mol⁻¹
questions.explanation: Extra energy = 1800/2 = 900 kJ; nH₂O = 900/45 = 20 moles; Weight = 20 × 18 = 360 g
questions.tip_formula: Energy for evaporation = n × ΔHvap; Mass = n × M
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: A litre of buffer solution contains 0.1 mole of each of NH₃ and NH₄Cl. On the addition of 0.02 mole of HCl by dissolving gaseous HCl, the pH of the solution is found to be ______ × 10⁻³ (Nearest integer). Given: pKb(NH₃) = 4.745, log 2 = 0.301, log 3 = 0.477, T = 298 K
questions.tip_formula: Henderson-Hasselbalch: pOH = pKb + log([salt]/[base])
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of correct statement/s from the following is ______. A. The pH of Na₂CO₃ solution is less than 7. B. The conjugate acid of HCO₃⁻ is H₂CO₃. C. The conjugate base of HCO₃⁻ is CO₃²⁻. D. The pH of (NH₄)₂SO₄ solution is greater than 7.
questions.explanation: A: False (Na₂CO₃ is basic, pH > 7); B: True; C: True; D: False ((NH₄)₂SO₄ is acidic, pH < 7). So 2 correct statements.
questions.tip_formula: Salt of strong base + weak acid = basic; Salt of weak base + strong acid = acidic
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of correct statement/s about the complex [Co(NH₃)₄Cl₂]⁺ from the following is ______. A. It can show geometrical isomerism. B. It can show optical isomerism. C. It is a diamagnetic complex. D. It is an outer orbital complex.
questions.explanation: A: True (cis-trans isomers possible); B: False (no optical isomerism); C: True (Co³⁺, d⁶, low spin, diamagnetic); D: False (inner orbital complex, d²sp³). So 2 correct statements.
questions.tip_formula: MA₄B₂ type octahedral = geometrical isomerism; Co³⁺ (d⁶) low spin = diamagnetic, inner orbital
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of correct statement/s about interstitial compounds from the following is ______. A. They have high melting points. B. They are very hard. C. They have metallic conductivity. D. They are chemically very reactive.
questions.explanation: A: True; B: True; C: True; D: False (they are chemically inert). So 3 correct statements.
questions.tip_formula: Interstitial compounds: high MP, hard, metallic conductivity, chemically inert
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of correct statement/s about the complex [Co(NH₃)₄Cl₂]⁺ from the following is ______. A. It can show geometrical isomerism. B. It can show optical isomerism. C. It is a diamagnetic complex. D. It is an outer orbital complex.
questions.explanation: A: True (cis-trans isomers possible); B: False (no optical isomerism); C: True (Co³⁺, d⁶, low spin, diamagnetic); D: False (inner orbital complex, d²sp³). So 2 correct statements.
questions.tip_formula: MA₄B₂ type octahedral = geometrical isomerism; Co³⁺ (d⁶) low spin = diamagnetic, inner orbital
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of correct statement/s about interstitial compounds from the following is ______. A. They have high melting points. B. They are very hard. C. They have metallic conductivity. D. They are chemically very reactive.
questions.explanation: A: True; B: True; C: True; D: False (they are chemically inert). So 3 correct statements.
questions.tip_formula: Interstitial compounds: high MP, hard, metallic conductivity, chemically inert
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of correct statement/s about the complex [Co(NH₃)₄Cl₂]⁺ from the following is ______. A. It can show geometrical isomerism. B. It can show optical isomerism. C. It is a diamagnetic complex. D. It is an outer orbital complex.
questions.explanation: A: True (cis-trans isomers possible); B: False (no optical isomerism); C: True (Co³⁺, d⁶, low spin, diamagnetic); D: False (inner orbital complex, d²sp³). So 2 correct statements.
questions.tip_formula: MA₄B₂ type octahedral = geometrical isomerism; Co³⁺ (d⁶) low spin = diamagnetic, inner orbital
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of correct statement/s about interstitial compounds from the following is ______. A. They have high melting points. B. They are very hard. C. They have metallic conductivity. D. They are chemically very reactive.
questions.explanation: A: True; B: True; C: True; D: False (they are chemically inert). So 3 correct statements.
questions.tip_formula: Interstitial compounds: high MP, hard, metallic conductivity, chemically inert
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.explanation: A: True (cis-trans isomers possible); B: False (no optical isomerism); C: True (Co³⁺, d⁶, low spin, diamagnetic); D: False (inner orbital complex, d²sp³). So 2 correct statements.
